en.title: Nouns
en.content:
Spanish nouns consider both gender and number.

Gender may be either masculine or feminine.

Masculine: el hombre (the man)

Feminine: la mujer (the woman)

Plural nouns are formed by adding -s to singular nouns ending in vowels, and -es to singular nouns ending in constants: los hombres, las mujeres.

en.title: Definite Articles
en.content:
The definite article is the in English.

MasculineFeminineNeuter
Singularellalo
Pluralloslas-

Articles must agree in gender and number with nouns: el hombre, los hombres.

The neuter article lo is used with adjectives.

en.title: Indefinite Articles
en.content:
The indefinite article is a and an in English.

MasculineFeminine
Singularella
Pluralloslas

Articles must agree in gender and number with nouns: uno hombre, unos hombres.

en.title: Contractions
en.content:
Spanish has two contractions. Unlike contractions such as do not/don't which are optional in English, in Spanish the following contractions are always gramatically required:

a + el = al

de + el = del

The only exception is when el is a proper noun, i.e. voy a El Salvador.
